stream_context.summary: Kaze spent most of the stream implementing and tuning the new “Freezie” enemy for Course 11’s Ice-Castle, showcased advanced lighting and camera work in the Oil-Factory level, debugged a missing lighting effect, and discussed future physics changes and star-count plans.

development_findings.summary: Work is now focused on Course 11 (Ice-Castle); progress was slow because Kaze had been polishing the Oil-Factory stage and producing a YouTube video.
development_findings.quote: Today we're working on the ice castle on the freezy here. I was really busy working on the oil level and the new video so not much progress has been made here.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a spline-based dynamic light that moves with platforms; idea originated from Biobak.
development_findings.quote: You see how the dots move depending on how the platform moves—that was Biobak's idea.

development_findings.summary: Discovered that a scripted room-dimming effect in the Oil-Factory stops triggering after a recent change; will fix off-stream.
development_findings.quote: Here you were supposed to talk to him and then the whole room gets darker… the effect is missing. This really really sucks.

development_findings.summary: Freezie enemy now inhales snow, freezes Mario, and will later exhale ice shards; particle system tuned during stream (cone vs. cylinder debate, opacity curve, velocity, etc.).
development_findings.quote: The Freezie will freeze you if the breath hits you… it's gonna be sucking up snow and then just shooting it at you like that.

development_findings.summary: Proposed nerf to the ground-pound dive: drastically limit mid-air angle change (~30°) so jumps feel more ‘committed’ and don’t trivialize level design; polling community for feedback.
development_findings.quote: Maybe a better way to handle the dive… you can't really change your angle with it anymore… I think that might still feel good and be more in line with the rest of the game.

development_findings.summary: UI framework optimized so inactive elements cost only ~0.1 µs each, letting Kaze add HUD effects freely.
development_findings.quote: That's why I can add UI elements with just 0.1 microseconds of performance loss while they're inactive.

development_findings.summary: Star-count roadmap: ~130 core stars plus ~9 overworld stars and ~45 ‘Yoshi mission’/comet-style challenges; expects final total ≈180. Only 3-4 100-coin stars to avoid grind.
development_findings.quote: Looks like it's going to be 180 stars.

development_findings.summary: Accessibility concept: optional ‘sight-seeing’ mode that slows Mario 20 % and lowers gravity instead of modifying HP, letting casual players explore without reworking levels.
development_findings.quote: If we have a sightseeing mode… make Mario maybe 20% slower but also reduce gravity… that's what I would consider a sightseeing mode.

development_findings.summary: Tooling upgrade: single-button ROM upload to real N64 hardware and switch to F3DX renderer, which outperforms F3D for him.
development_findings.quote: Let me just upload my ROM hack to the N64 real quick, which I can do with a button press now… F3DX performs better than F3D right now for me.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s first child (Reyna) is due in four weeks; he intends to take parental leave and stream more during that period.
context_findings.quote: My daughter will be born in four weeks… that means I get time off and I will likely stream a little more.

context_findings.summary: Reyna is named in memory of a friend of Zeina’s who died at age 12.
context_findings.quote: She's named after a friend of mine that passed away when I was 12 years old.

context_findings.summary: Kaze worries about online and real-world safety for his future daughter, reflecting on predators, social-media limits, and teaching internet safety.
context_findings.quote: Having a daughter I think is going to be scary, because there's so many predators out there.

context_findings.summary: Video-editing bottlenecks his YouTube output; considering hiring an editor at $16 per finished minute to accelerate releases.
context_findings.quote: My YouTube output is so hard bottlenecked by my unwillingness to make videos… someone offering to make video editing for me… I'm probably taking that deal.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: offer ‘choose-your-own-difficulty’ jumps so skilled players can take risks while casuals have safer routes; minimal HP relevance.
context_findings.quote: I want the game to not be difficult; I want it to be pick your own difficulty where you can go for risky jumps and do the difficult thing or you can do the easy thing.

biobak.summary: Suggested the moving light-dot effect tied to platform motion in Oil-Factory.
Proposed adding speed-line screen effects and pointed out spacing issues with electric amps in factory room.
Recommended converting exploding leaf piles into particle effects for performance.

zeina.summary: Joined voice call briefly; shared personal story behind daughter’s name Reyna.
Helped set up stream visuals for baby room; discusses parenting concerns with Kaze.

key_stories.title: Factory Lighting Bug
key_stories.summary: While demoing the Oil-Factory, Kaze noticed the scripted room-dimming effect no longer triggered after talking to the exhausted Toad that powers the factory.
key_stories.challenge: Lighting event suddenly stopped working after recent changes.
key_stories.process: Tested the event live, confirmed the room stayed bright, searched code briefly but deferred deeper debugging.
key_stories.outcome: Bug acknowledged; Kaze will fix it off-stream.
key_stories.key_quote: The effect is missing. This really really sucks.

key_stories.title: Building the Freezie Enemy
key_stories.summary: Kaze designed a new Ice-Castle foe that inhales snow and freezes Mario. He iterated on particle shapes, angles, and scaling while discussing visual clarity with chat.
key_stories.challenge: Create convincing inhalation/exhalation VFX without hurting performance.
key_stories.process: Tried cylinder vs cone particle sprays, reused Dino-nose particles, tuned opacity curves, and froze Mario’s animation with a blinking gag.
key_stories.outcome: Functional inhale-freeze prototype completed; ice shards and final polish still pending.
key_stories.key_quote: What do you think of the VFX here? He kind of reminds me of the snifits.

key_stories.title: Debating a Dive Nerf
key_stories.summary: After talking with another designer, Kaze questioned whether the ground-pound dive undermines level design by letting experts recover too easily.
key_stories.challenge: Ground-pound dive may trivialize challenges while offering little help to casual players.
key_stories.process: Outlined rationale live, then prototyped a version that caps mid-air angle change to ~30° and sought viewer feedback.
key_stories.outcome: No final decision yet; idea under community review.
key_stories.key_quote: You can't really change your angle with it anymore… I think that might still feel good and be more in line with the rest of the game.

key_stories.title: Naming Their Daughter
key_stories.summary: Zeina revealed that their soon-to-be-born daughter’s name, Reyna, honors a childhood friend who passed away young.
key_stories.challenge: Select a meaningful name for their first child.
key_stories.process: Discussed options and sentimental reasons on stream; showed completed baby room.
key_stories.outcome: Name finalized as Reyna; room prepared.
key_stories.key_quote: Reyna is named after a friend of mine that passed away when I was 12 years old.

key_stories.title: Outsourcing Video Editing
key_stories.summary: Kaze’s disdain for editing restricts his channel’s growth, so he’s negotiating with an editor to handle post-production.
key_stories.challenge: Limited content output due to editing workload.
key_stories.process: Showed a sample edit from the freelancer and weighed cost ($16/min) against potential productivity gains.
key_stories.outcome: Leaning toward hiring the editor, which could greatly increase video frequency.
key_stories.key_quote: We can make so many more videos. My YouTube output is so hard bottlenecked by my unwillingness to make videos.

open_questions.context: Kaze prototyped a restricted-angle dive but left the change unconfirmed.
questions: Have you settled on the new dive constraints?
What play-testing data will inform the decision?
How will the change ripple through existing level layouts?

open_questions.context: Prototype inhalation works, but ice-shard exhale and final visuals remain unfinished.
questions: What is the remaining task list for the Freezie?
Any performance concerns with the final particle count?
Will the freeze mechanic affect Mario’s momentum or only animation?

open_questions.context: Room-dimming effect stopped working; cause not identified on stream.
questions: What broke the lighting script?
Was it a recent renderer switch, object ID change, or threading issue?
Any broader implications for other scripted events?

open_questions.context: Kaze is weighing 45 extra Yoshi missions and possible emerald hunts.
questions: What criteria will determine the final star count?
How will you avoid ‘padding’ while keeping these missions fresh?
Will emerald hunts require new tech (radar, hints)?

open_questions.context: Idea to slow Mario and tweak gravity instead of changing HP.
questions: Will this mode be selectable at start or toggled anytime?
How will you ensure timings and puzzles still work?
Could it be expanded into multiple difficulty presets?
Have you formally contracted the editor?
What content cadence are you targeting post-hire?
Will the editor also handle motion graphics or only cuts?

open_questions.context: Claimed 0.1 µs overhead per inactive element.
questions: What architectural change enabled this optimization?
Can this system be generalized for modders?
Any limits on number of simultaneous UI widgets?
